Table code

There are three attributes you have to define to use the interactive table.

tink-headers

you have to bind the headers you want to use to this attribute
the tink-headers is an array that contain objects that are from the following structure. scope.headers = [ { field: 'username', // The property name that is the same as in the tinkData object alias: 'Gebruikersnaam', // The alias how it's going to be called in the table. checked: true, // If the column is visible or not (can be changed in the column sorter). disabled: false, // If its 'checked' status can be changed or not sortalias: 'Gebruiker' // Different name in the sorter } ]

tink-data

you have to bind the data of the rows you want to view to this attribute
the tink-data is an array that contain a object with properties of your choise.

tink-actions

You can also defined actions in the interactive table
To use these actions you have to add an array of objects with the folowing structre to the tink-actions attribute. scope.actions = [ { name: 'remove', // the name of the actions callback: function(items) { // here you are going to write what happen when they clicked on the button. // The items variable contains the items that are checked. }, order:0, // The order the button is viewed in the bar master:false, // If the button is a master button or not ! this value is required. icon:'fa-bell-o' // The icon ('font-awesome') thats going to be showed. this is required ! } ]
